abstract: International Assn of Athletics Federations clears Russian long jumper Darya Klishina to compete as neutral athlete at 2016 Olympics, but final authorization lies with International Olympic Committee.
lead_paragraph: Darya Klishina was cleared by the International Association of Athletics Federations to compete as a neutral athlete at the Olympics in Rio. But the final authorization lies with the I.O.C.

headline.main: Second Russian Track Athlete Exempted From Ban by the Sport’s Governing Body
headline.print_headline: Second Exemption in Russian Track Ban

snippet: Darya Klishina was cleared by the International Association of Athletics Federations to compete as a neutral athlete at the Olympics in Rio. But the final authorization lies with the I.O.C....
